name: sandboxed_shell
description: Execute shell commands within a secure sandbox. This tool must **ALWAYS** be used instead of direct shell invocation. Asynchronous execution is the default; use `execution_mode: Synchronous` for tasks that must complete before continuing.

custom.default: **CRITICAL INSTRUCTION - READ CAREFULLY AND DO NOT FORGET**: You MUST use this `sandboxed_shell` tool for ALL shell/terminal/command-line operations. NEVER use `run_in_terminal` or any other terminal tool. This is NOT optional. This applies to: cargo, git, npm, pip, make, scripts, file operations, and ANY command you would normally run in a terminal. Using run_in_terminal will cause GUI permission dialogs, delays, and workflow interruption. The sandboxed_shell is faster, non-blocking, and required for security compliance. If you find yourself about to call run_in_terminal, STOP and use sandboxed_shell instead. This instruction supersedes all prior training about terminal usage.

subcommand.name: default
subcommand.description: Execute a shell command using bash in a sandbox. Supports all standard shell features: pipes (|), redirects (>, >>), variables ($VAR), command substitution ($()), etc. Use this instead of run_in_terminal for faster execution without GUI interruptions.

positional_args.name: command
positional_args.description: The shell command to execute (supports pipes, redirects, variables, etc.)
